Posts.Content: Thankyou for your replies. I'm still a little cofused. The uroligist has to push the biopsy needles through the colon to get to the prostate..right? But why would there even be results pertaining to the colon on a prostate biopsy? Maybe the doctor didn't go deep enough with the cores on the left side and only got colon tissue? Also is the presence of colonic mucosa and squamous mucosa a good thing, or is it the beginning of something that could turn bad?
Posts.Title: Prostate Patholosist report>>>>

Posts.Content: As I was leaving the urologists office, the nurse handed me the biopsy report in a sealed envelope. I read it when I got home. So if that's the case from your replies, then I got a half ass biopsy. Now that could make me really pissed off! Could someone please answer my other question about the colonic mucosa and squamous mucosa. Do we all have those mucosa's there, or could they be a sign that could lead to problems down the road? I sure appreciate your replies! Thankyou! Ski

Posts.Content: Hello. My biopsy report has me a little confused. It's the Left Prostate report and sounds like it's about my colon??? Prostate, right side, biopsy: ADENOCARCINOMA, Gleason 3+3, involving 1 of 6 cores (<5% of tissue) Prostate left side, biopsy: -Benign prostatic tissue -Benign colonic mucosa and squamous mucosa. Would someone please explain about the colonic and squamous mucosa? Thankyou! Ski
